intro: Cronquistianthus celendinensis, commonly known as the Celendine Cronquistia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments.
